body.p: Given this conclusion, which type of error is a possibility?

response.name: type_i
response.feedback: Correct. In a type I error, we reject a null hypothesis that is true. Here, the researchers conclude that the larger proportion of breast cancer and heart disease was statistically significant; therefore, they have rejected the null hypothesis of “no difference.”

response.name: type_ii
response.feedback: Incorrect. In a type II error, we fail to reject a null hypothesis that is false. We cannot make a type II error by rejecting the null hypothesis. Here, the researchers conclude that the larger proportion of breast cancer and heart disease is statistically significant; therefore, they have rejected the null hypothesis of “no difference.” Please try again.

response.name: impossible_to_tell
response.feedback: Incorrect. Each type of error relates to a specific conclusion from the hypothesis test. We have to reject the null hypothesis to make a type I error. We have to fail to reject the null hypothesis to make a type II error. What conclusion did the researchers make? Based on this conclusion, please try again.

part.hint: Remember, you are trying to determine what type of error—type I or type II—the researchers could have made based on the data.
A type I error is possible only if we reject the H0. A type II error is possible only if we fail to reject the H0.
